title: Water Procurement in Nuclear Fallout Areas
brief: How to find and purify safe drinking water in radioactive contaminated areas.
steps: Step 1: Wait at least 48 hours before drinking any water to allow radioactive decay.
Step 2: Prioritize underground sources: springs, wells, or water from pipes in abandoned buildings.
Step 3: Use snow from 15+ centimeters below the surface during fallout.
Step 4: For streams/rivers, dig sediment holes along the side to create natural filtration.
Step 5: For standing water, fill container 3/4 full, add 2.5cm dirt per 10cm water, stir well.
Step 6: Let dirt mixture settle for 6+ hours, then dip out clear water from top.
Step 7: Filter all water through additional filtration device before drinking.
Step 8: Treat with purification tablets or boil as additional precaution.
warnings: Standing water from lakes and ponds will be heavily contaminated.
Even 'clean' water sources may contain harmful bacteria.
Seepage basin filtration can remove up to 99% of radioactivity but requires proper covering.
